summary: This document is an email chain from July 24-25, 2019, discussing the initial reports of Jeffrey Epstein being found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck. It reveals discrepancies in the initial reporting and mentions that Epstein's cellmate reported being threatened. The correspondence is between law enforcement officials.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the report; found in his cell with a noose around his neck and placed on suicide watch.

persons.name: Associate Warden
persons.role: Bureau of Prisons official at MCC New York
persons.context: Reported the incident of finding Jeffrey Epstein in his cell with a noose to the email recipients.

persons.name: SHU Lieutenant
persons.role: Lieutenant in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York
persons.context: Wrote the first report about the incident, mentioning only redness on Epstein's neck without noting an object.

persons.name: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal
persons.role: Law enforcement official from the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Sender of the final email in the chain, identified in the document footer.

connections.description: The Associate Warden was responsible for reporting the incident involving Epstein in custody.
The SHU Lieutenant wrote the initial report on the incident involving Epstein in his cell.
Epstein's cellmate reported being threatened by Epstein, according to the Associate Warden's report.

events.title: Epstein Found with Noose in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York at 0127 hours in a fetal position with a noose around his neck. He was escorted to medical, assessed, and initially placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Threat Report from Cellmate
events.description: Epstein's cellmate reported being threatened by Epstein.

events.title: Discrepancy in Incident Reports Discussed
events.description: Email correspondence reveals a discrepancy between the SHU Lieutenant's initial report (mentioning only neck redness) and supplemental reports from two other officers who noted an object around Epstein's neck.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell on the morning of July 24, 2019, with a noose around his neck and was placed on suicide watch.
There was a discrepancy in official reports: the first report by a SHU Lieutenant mentioned only redness on Epstein's neck, while two other officers reported seeing an object around his neck.
Epstein's cellmate reported that Epstein had threatened to kill him.
The incident was under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons at the time of the correspondence.
The email chain indicates internal law enforcement communication and concern about the reporting and Epstein's removal from suicide watch.
